meanings.definition: Strict adherence to a particular set of beliefs or principles, especially relating to morality or religion.
meanings.sent1: Her puritanisms made her refuse to watch any movies rated above PG.
meanings.sent2: The community's puritanisms influenced their daily routines and interactions.
meanings.sent3: His puritanisms were so strong that he wouldn't even eat dessert on weekdays.
meanings.sent4: The puritanisms of the group were like a heavy cloak, weighing down any hint of frivolity.
meanings.sent5: The puritanisms of the town were as rigid as the stone walls of the church.

meanings.definition: Behaviors or attitudes characterized by strict moral or religious standards.
meanings.sent1: The puritanisms of the family were evident in their modest clothing and simple lifestyle.
meanings.sent2: She couldn't stand his puritanisms, always preaching about right and wrong.
meanings.sent3: Their puritanisms led them to organize a charity event to help those in need.
meanings.sent4: The puritanisms of the school board were like a fortress against any form of fun.
meanings.sent5: His puritanisms were so extreme, he wouldn't even allow laughter in his presence.
